{{Day}}

==Events==
* [[619]] &ndash; A qaghan of the [[Western Turkic Khanate]] is [[Tang campaigns against the Western Turks|assassinated]] in a Chinese palace by Eastern Turkic rivals after the approval of [[Tang Dynasty|Tang]] emperor [[Emperor Gaozu of Tang|Gaozu]].
*[[1410]] &ndash; The Peace of [[Bicêtre]].
*[[1675]] &ndash; [[Plymouth Colony]] governor [[Josiah Winslow]] leads a colonial militia against the [[Narragansett people|Narragansett]] during [[King Philip's War]].
*[[1868]] &ndash; [[Time zone]]: New Zealand officially adopts a standard time to be observed nationally.
*[[1882]] &ndash; [[Oulu]], Finland is devastated by the [[Great Oulu Fire of 1882]].
*[[1889]] &ndash; [[North Dakota|North]] and [[South Dakota]] are admitted as the 39th and 40th [[U.S. state]]s.
*[[1895]] &ndash; The first gasoline-powered race in the United States; first prize is $2,000.
*[[1898]] &ndash; [[Cheerleading]] is started at the [[University of Minnesota]] with Johnny Campbell leading the crowd in cheering on the [[American football|football]] team.
*[[1899]] &ndash; The [[Boers]] begin their 118 day [[Siege of Ladysmith|siege]] of British held [[Ladysmith, South Africa|Ladysmith]] during the [[Second Boer War]].
*[[1909]] &ndash; [[Lambda Chi Alpha]] fraternity is founded at [[Boston University]].
*[[1914]] &ndash; World War I: The [[Russian Empire]] declares war on the [[Ottoman Empire]] and the [[Dardanelles]] are subsequently closed.
*[[1917]] &ndash; The [[Balfour Declaration]] proclaims British support for the "establishment in [[Palestine]] of a national home for the Jewish people" with the clear understanding "that nothing shall be done which may prejudice the civil and religious rights of existing non-Jewish communities".
*  1917   &ndash; The [[Military Revolutionary Committee]] of the [[Petrograd Soviet]], in charge of preparation and carrying out the [[Russian Revolution]], holds its first meeting.
*[[1920]] &ndash; In the United States, [[KDKA (AM)|KDKA]] of [[Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania]] starts broadcasting as the first commercial [[radio station]]. The first broadcast is the result of the [[United States presidential election, 1920]].
*  1920   &ndash; [[Adam Martin Wyant]] became the first former professional [[American football]] player [[United States House of Representatives elections, 1920|to be elected]] to the [[United States Congress]]. 
*[[1930]] &ndash; [[Haile Selassie]] is crowned emperor of [[Ethiopia]].
*[[1936]] &ndash; The [[Canadian Broadcasting Corporation]] is established.
*  1936   &ndash; Italian dictator [[Benito Mussolini]] proclaims the Rome-Berlin Axis, establishing the alliance of the [[Axis powers]].
*  1936   &ndash; The [[British Broadcasting Corporation]] initiates the [[BBC Television Service]], the world's first regular, "high-definition" (then defined as at least 200 lines) service. Renamed [[BBC One|BBC1]] in [[1964]], the channel still runs to this day.
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: First day of [[Battle of Elaia–Kalamas]] between the Greeks and the Italians.
*[[1947]] &ndash; In [[California]], designer [[Howard Hughes]] performs the maiden (and only) flight of the [[Spruce Goose]] or H-4 The Hercules; the largest fixed-wing [[aircraft]] ever built.
*[[1949]] &ndash; The [[Dutch–Indonesian Round Table Conference]] ends with the Netherlands agreeing to transfer sovereignty of the [[Dutch East Indies]] to the [[Republic of the United States of Indonesia|United States of Indonesia]].
*[[1951]] &ndash; [[Korean War]]: A small platoon of 28 Canadian soldiers defend a vital area against an entire battalion of 800 Chinese troops in the Battle of the Song-gok Spur. The engagement lasts into the early hours of November 3. 
*[[1953]] &ndash; The Constituent Assembly of [[Pakistan]] names the country The Islamic Republic of Pakistan.
*[[1957]] &ndash; The [[Levelland UFO Case]] in [[Levelland, Texas]], generates national publicity.
*[[1959]] &ndash; [[Quiz show scandals]]: ''[[Twenty One (game show)|Twenty One]]'' [[game show]] contestant [[Charles Van Doren]] admits to a [[Congress of the United States|Congressional]] committee that he had been given questions and answers in advance.
*  1959   &ndash; The first section of the [[M1 motorway]], the first inter-urban [[motorway]] in the United Kingdom, is opened between the present junctions 5 and 18, along with the [[M10 motorway (Great Britain)|M10 motorway]] and [[M45 motorway]].
*[[1960]] &ndash; [[Penguin Books]] is found not guilty of [[obscenity]] in the trial ''[[R v Penguin Books Ltd.]]'', the ''[[Lady Chatterley's Lover]]'' case.
*[[1963]] &ndash; [[South Vietnam]]ese President [[Ngô Đình Diệm]] is [[Arrest and assassination of Ngô Đình Diệm|assassinated]] following a military [[coup]].
*[[1964]] &ndash; King [[Saud of Saudi Arabia]] is deposed by a family [[coup]], and replaced by his half-brother [[Faisal of Saudi Arabia|Faisal]].
*[[1965]] &ndash; [[Norman Morrison]], a 31-year-old [[Quaker]], sets himself on fire in front of the river entrance to [[the Pentagon]] to protest the use of [[napalm]] in the Vietnam war.
*[[1966]] &ndash; The [[Cuban Adjustment Act]] comes into force, allowing 123,000 [[Cuba]]ns the opportunity to apply for permanent residence in the United States.
*[[1967]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: US President [[Lyndon B. Johnson]] and "The Wise Men" conclude that the American people should be given more optimistic reports on the progress of the war.
*[[1973]] &ndash; The [[Communist Party of India (Marxist)]] and the [[Communist Party of India]] form a 'United Front' in the state of [[Tripura]].
*[[1974]] &ndash; 78 die when the Time Go-Go Club in [[Seoul]], South Korea burns down. Six of the victims jumped to their deaths from the seventh floor after a club official barred the doors after the fire started.
*[[1977]] &ndash; [[South Ockendon Windmill]], a smock mill at [[South Ockendon]], [[Essex]], England collapsed.
*[[1982]] &ndash; [[Channel 4]] is launched in the United Kingdom.
*[[1983]] &ndash; U.S. President [[Ronald Reagan]] signs a bill creating [[Martin Luther King, Jr. Day]].
*[[1984]] &ndash; [[Capital punishment]]: [[Velma Barfield]] becomes the first woman executed in the United States since [[1962]].
*[[1988]] &ndash; The [[Morris worm]], the first [[internet]]-distributed [[computer worm]] to gain significant mainstream media attention, is launched from [[Massachusetts Institute of Technology|MIT]].
*[[1990]] &ndash; [[British Satellite Broadcasting]] and [[Sky Television plc]] merge to form BSkyB as a result of massive losses.
*[[2000]] &ndash; The [[Expedition 1|first resident crew]] to the [[ISS]] docked with their [[Soyuz TM-31]] spacecraft.
*[[2007]] &ndash; 50,000–100,000 people [[2007 Georgian demonstrations|demonstrate against the Georgian government]] in [[Tbilisi]].
